tourBios.exmtStatus: Exempt - Finished 2-10 at 2014 Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament (subject to third reshuffle)
tourBios.curYearHigh: Late in the year, at the New South Wales PGA Championship on the PGA Tour of Australasia, opened with a 66-68 to take the 36-hole lead at the event at Riverside Oaks Golf Resort's Bungool Course. Played the weekend in 1-under (71-72) to drop into a T2 with four others, two shots short of winner Jarryd Felton.
tourBios.carHigh:
2014: Played nine events on PGA Tour of Australasia and recorded two top-10s, including a T3 at the Western Australia Open Championship in October...Qualified for The Open Championship and made the cut, finishing 72nd. Was paired with Tiger Woods and Jordan Spieth in the third round...Finished fourth at the Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament...In December, closed with rounds of 67-67-76-68, which jumped him from T71 after the first two days...Also played on the OneAsia Tour. 

2013: Played primarily on the OneAsia Tour.

2012: In his lone Web.com Tour appearance, missed the cut. 

2010: Played in two Web.com Tour tournaments, missing the cut in both. 

2009: Played in his first Web.com Tour tournament as a professional, opening with a 64 at the WNB Golf Classic in Midland, Texas. Went on to T27.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Four-time NAIA All-American and a three-time NAIA Academic All-American at Oklahoma Christian University in Edmond, Okla...Made his Web.com Tour debut, missing the cut at the Preferred Health Systems Wichita Open.
tourBios.personal: In May 2012, shot a 16-under-par 55 at River Oaks GC in Edmond, Okla., a round later recognized by the Guinness Book of World as the lowest of all time... Entrance song on the first tee would be "Down Under" by Men at Work...Biggest thrill in golf was playing in the 2014 Open Championship...Favorite golf course played is Royal Dornoch in Scotland...Biggest thrill outside golf was getting married...Favorite pro team is the Oklahoma City Thunder and favorite athlete is Roger Federer...Played with Tiger Woods and Jordan Spieth at The Open Championship...Says he would like to trade places with Rob Dyrdek for a day because he is very funny on TV...Not many people know he likes classic cars and has a 1971 GMC pickup truck...Bucket list includes playing Augusta National and retiring at 35...Dream foursome includes his father, Ben Hogan and Greg Norman...Twitter account handle is @rheingibson55.

tourBios.exmtStatus: 20th on the 2015 Web.com Tour priority list
tourBios.curYearHigh: Late in the year, at the New South Wales PGA Championship on the PGA Tour of Australasia, opened with a 66-68 to take the 36-hole lead at the event at Riverside Oaks Golf Resort's Bungool Course. Played the weekend in 1-under (71-72) to drop into a T2 with four others, two shots short of winner Jarryd Felton.
tourBios.carHigh:
2015: Finished the Web.com Tour season having played all 25 tournaments. Had one runner-up, one third-place finish, six top-10s, seven top-25s and 11 made cuts. Was 20th in the final priority-ranking order...Celebrated his 29th birthday by starting his final round at the seaon-opening Panama Claro Championship with five consecutive birdies. Added two more, at Nos. 7 and 9, for a 7-under 28 on the front nine that featured eight 3s. Early blitz moved him to 7-under for the tournament, two off the lead. Stumbled on the final nine and settled for a 4-under 66 and a T6 finish...In late March, blistered Le Triomphe G&CC in the first round of the Chitimacha Louisiana Open with a 9-under 62, his lowest career score on Tour. Entered the second sound with a two-stroke advantage and carded a 68 to maintain his two-stroke lead. Fell one shot back of the 54-hole lead after a third-round 70 but came out on fire at the start of the final round, getting to 16-under par after seven holes. Struggled after that, with three bogeys in seven holes to finish T2, one stroke behind winner Kelly Kraft. Rose to 13th on the money list...Would miss his next five cuts...In June, earned his third top 10 of the season, finishing T3 in Wichita at the Air Capital Classic. Posted 69-68 and was well off the 36-hole pace. Shot 67 in the third round to put him T18 after 54 holes. On Sunday, carded a final-round 65 for the top-three performance...First Tour hole-in-one came during the second round of Albertsons Boise Open...Four rounds in the 60s at the Stonebrae Classic in July resulted in a T6...Regular Season ended with a T71 and four missed cuts, placing him 33rd on the money list prior to the start of the Finals...Picked up his first top-10 of the Web.com Tour finals at the Nationwide Children's Hospital Championship. Was one back of the lead heading into the weekend and carded 72-73 for a T9.

2014: Played nine events on PGA Tour of Australasia and recorded two top-10s, including a T3 at the Western Australia Open Championship in October...Qualified for The Open Championship and made the cut, finishing 72nd. Was paired with Tiger Woods and Jordan Spieth in the third round...Finished fourth at the Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament...In December, closed with rounds of 67-67-76-68, which jumped him from T71 after the first two days...Also played on the OneAsia Tour. 

2013: Played primarily on the OneAsia Tour.

2012: In his lone Web.com Tour appearance, missed the cut. 

2010: Played in two Web.com Tour tournaments, missing the cut in both. 

2009: Played in his first Web.com Tour tournament as a professional, opening with a 64 at the WNB Golf Classic in Midland, Texas. Went on to T27.
Amateur: Four-time NAIA All-American and a three-time NAIA Academic All-American at Oklahoma Christian University in Edmond, Okla...Made his Web.com Tour debut, missing the cut at the Preferred Health Systems Wichita Open.
tourBios.personal: In May 2012, shot a 16-under-par 55 at River Oaks GC in Edmond, Okla., a round later recognized by the Guinness Book of World as the lowest of all time... Entrance song on the first tee would be "Down Under" by Men at Work...Biggest thrill in golf was playing in the 2014 Open Championship...Favorite golf course played is Royal Dornoch in Scotland...Biggest thrill outside golf was getting married...Favorite pro team is the Oklahoma City Thunder and favorite athlete is Roger Federer...Played with Tiger Woods and Jordan Spieth at The Open Championship...Says he would like to trade places with Rob Dyrdek for a day because he is very funny on TV...Not many people know he likes classic cars and has a 1971 GMC pickup truck...Bucket list includes playing Augusta National and retiring at 35...Dream foursome includes his father, Ben Hogan and Greg Norman...Twitter account handle is @rheingibson55.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the PGA TOUR was T52nd in 2016 at the Shell Houston Open.
dyn.dynStats: He ranks T75th in Driving Distance - Driver on the PGA TOUR.
